benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.view

Class CrimeIndexCompactView

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.view.CrimeIndexCompactView

  • public class CrimeIndexCompactView
extends View
    A custom view class used to display a crime index value.

    This class displays the crime index as a gauge. The gauge has a visible scale and a hand showing the value on that scale.

    The scale goes from the minimum crime index value to the maximum crime index value. The scale is colored. It goes from red at the scale's minimum through the midpoint colors in between the minimum and maximum to green at the scales's maximum. All the scale's colors are stored in the color midpoints array. The colors between the midpoints are interpolated.

    The scale is visualized as a part of a ring. I call this ring the crime index ring. The effect of a ring is created with the two circles, one for the outer boundary of the ring (the outer circle) and one for the inner boundary of the ring (the inner circle). The circles are drawn with the same center, the crime index ring center (mInnerCircleX, mInnerCircleY), but with the two different radii mInnerCircleRadius, mOuterCircleRadius.

    The outer circle is drawn using the SweepGradient configured to use the color midpoints array.

    The inner circle is drawn atop of the outer circle to create the ring effect.

    The scale begins at a certain angle INDEX_START_ANGLE within the crime index ring, where the sweep gradient begins with the scale's minumum color, and goes along the crime index ring center spanning an angle of INDEX_SWIPE_ANGLE right to the point, where the sweep gradient finishes with the scale's maximum color.

    Finally, the index hand is drawn atop of the both whole drawing. The index hand works as a clock hand, showing the crime index value on the crime index scale. It starts at the crime index ring center.

    Author:
    Tom

    • Method Detail

      • computeIndexHand

        private void computeIndexHand()
        Calculates the size and position of the crime index hand.

        Basic trigonometry is used.

      • getIndex

        public final float getIndex()
        Gets the current crime index value.
        Returns:
        the current crime index value

      • init

        private void init()
        Called from the constructor to initialize the paints, colors etc.

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(Canvas canvas)
        Called to draw the crime index gauge.

        The crime index gauge is drawn using the previously calculated geometry model. The outer circle with the sweep gradient is drawn. The inner circle is drawn atop of the outer circle to create a ring effect. Finally, the index hand is drawn. It starts at the center of the index ring and ends at the inner boundary of the crime ring.

      • onMeasure

        protected void onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec,
             int heightMeasureSpec)
        Measures the view's dimensions.

        The smaller of the available dimension values is used for both the width and height.

      • onSizeChanged

        protected void onSizeChanged(int w,
                 int h,
                 int oldw,
                 int oldh)
        Calculates the geometry model for this view.

        The drawing boundaries are set. The centers of both outer and inner circles as well as their radii are calculated. The size and position of the index hand is calculated. The size and the position for both the min and max crime index value label is calculated. The sweep gradient for the outer circle is created and set up to be used during the drawing phase.

      • setIndex

        public final void setIndex(float index)
        Sets the current crime index value.

        This invalidates the view, which may cause it to be redrawn.

        Parameters:
        index - the new crime index value to be set for this view
